intro: Lomaridium plumieri, commonly known as the plumier's lomaridium, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal and limestone habitats, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
